claims.object: The part of the brain where the optic nerves cross

surface_layer.definition: The optic chiasm is the part of the brain where the optic nerves cross.

deep_layer.mechanism: Axons from the nasal retina of each eye cross in the optic chiasm to the contralateral side of the brain, while axons from the temporal retina remain on the ipsilateral side.
deep_layer.origin: Develops during embryogenesis as part of the forebrain.
